creator: tushar@splendors.com
text:
The method public
  void doConfigure(java.net.URL configURL, LoggerRepository hierarchy) 
has code like
  props.load(configURL.openStream());

which results in the config file not being closed explicitly and leaves it upto 
the garbage collector to release the file handle. We ran into a situation where 
for a variety of reasons, this method got called repeatedly and the process ran 
out of file handles.

The solution is quite simple - just close the stream explicitly after you are 
done with it.
